Reviews.Title: “Ok for a shower and a bed”
Reviews.Author: QuixotikalOne
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel several times. It is nothing special but nor is it horrible. We have stayed here for 3 years in a row and while it does provide a nice little kitchenette with a full size fridge there are no utensils provided at all. That does make it sorta useless unless you travel with pots and pans and really not many people do. There is a grocery store within a miles distance but not much in the way of food without driving a mile or two. It is clean, fairly quiet and the staff is always helpful. Check in and checkout is never a hassle. The continental breakfast is pretty skimpy. Almost seems like day old baked goods. Overall if you are looking for a place to rest your head while visiting Sea World or some of the other things San Diego has to offer this place is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: brocrob
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 weeks for training. The only thing this place has going for is the location. They offer kitchens but don't expect to find a fork or a cooking utensil, the cabinets are empty. There's 4 laundry machines but none of them work. Little time later the vending machines ate my money. My mattress in my room should of been thrown out 5 years ago. Asked the maid which room has better bedding and she said there all the same. To get to the closest restaurant walking it's about a 20 minute walk up the hill. At least they had a real fitness room with weights to take out my frustration!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego for a week”
Reviews.Author: Juujuubean
Reviews.Content: For me, the location turned out to be perfect. As I arrived , the place looked decent. It was clean. I had a king bed , with a kitchenette. A two burner stove with a full size fridge, and a dishwasher. The dishwasher wasn't connected to the countertop like it should be, so a person would have to be carefull not to dump out the contents of the washer, or have it flip out from underneath the counter. Other than that the room was great. Cheesy furniture. Fourty somthing flat screen tv. Wireless internet that worked well. I used the exercise rooma couple of times. The seat on the bicycle was about to fall off, it had not been repaired by the time I left. Ex room could have used a freestanding fan. Because I was there for a week, I got a great rate!!! I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Parrakorg
Reviews.Content: Liked the fact that it had a mini kitchen on it, very close to freeways, however,no customer service. We were two minutes late for breakfast (because no one informed us about their hours) and we were not allowed to eat there. It is good for the price, just any questions you may have ask them directly.

Reviews.Title: “"Top Secret" Hotel Very Basic No Suprises”
Reviews.Author: motorcitymike53
Reviews.Content: Famous travel site offers this locale under a promotion that doesn't tell you the exact site until after it is booked. They probably should not go this basic if they want to keep site users happy. This is a 3 story Motel; all rooms open to the outside. Parking is mostly under the building with a small, slow elevator. Our room is clean but dated and includes a small kitchen area; frig, stovetop and micro. The lobby looks like a converted garage. The pool area is nice and includes a spa big enough for a dozen people. It is convient to freeways that take you to all San Diego attractions. $70 per night does not seem like a deal for this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Room was attractive and spotless”
Reviews.Author: jaelsne
Reviews.Content: First of all, I must tell you that I'm a hotel snob. I rarely stay at two star hotels, but it was hard to find a reasonably priced hotel during my stay in San Diego. After purchasing a stay via hotwire, I was dismayed to learn it was a Days Inn, and doubly dismayed to read the unfavorable review. I was so pleasantly surprised when I arrived. First appearances were not great. The lobby was not inviting, and the man at the front desk was coolly efficient but not at all rude. The pool and jacuzzi were clean and inviting. My room seems to have been newly renovated. The kitchen had new appliances and granite countertops. The walls and furniture were painted a warm yellow, and the green carpeting appeared fresh and new. The bed was comfortable. I couldnt have asked for more. It was definitely NOT the dump I had expected!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LisaLash21
Reviews.Content: i just stayed here 4 nights. The front office staff including the manager Paresh Patel were rude and uncaring, the opposite of customer service in fact. When I asked why the complimentary breakfast was late (it was 7:20AM and it was supposed to be out at 7AM) the Genl Manager was rude and didn't give a crap, telling me "it's complimentary" when I told him it was not OK for the breakfast to be late like it was so nice of him to do that, I shouldn't complain when it's late?? He apologized in a tone of antagonism and when I told him I didn't believe his apology he said "I take it back then". This is the general manager! The check in guy was rude as well, just not friendly. The rooms are larger than normal, but there's no utensils or cups or anything at all in the kitchen. The place needs work, easy enough things to fix, just looks run down, and a bit shabby. I won't stay there again, mostly because of the attitude of the staff there, as the other things could have been overlooked if the staff were friendly and the manager was truly apologetic about the breakfast being late.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Terrible is just a start...”
Reviews.Author: TonyMnUK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several Days Inn properties and this one has to be on the list as THE WORST! Picked this place on Travelocity. Should have read more reviews. Rooms are big but in need of updating. The beds are awful! I've had better breakfast choices at a gas station. It's right next to a very busy freeway and the windows aren't insulated. AVOID THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomdations with friendly and courteous people.”
Reviews.Author: Chath65
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this motel with one exception, although a in-between concern was the toilet that had some flushing problems due to water pressure or something. Other than that we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service EVER and they are theifs”
Reviews.Author: kcardenas
Reviews.Content: Hotel was old and dirty! I left a shirt in the closet and called the next morning and they said it wasn't there and was never checked into lost and found. (so one of the maids took it right?) Called 5 times...they kept saying call back and they will call us...finally after 4 days of calling the manager yelled at me and said if it's gone it's gone and he's not responsible. That he would call if it was found. 20 minutes later he called and "found it" but said he would not mail it...if I want it to go get it myself!! If I lived close enough to go get it I would not have been staying at the hotel!! THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, quiet & economical”
Reviews.Author: kumarpateel
Reviews.Content: I was staying there for 3 nights, Hotel has nice big rooms with small Kitchenates. I love their Pool area and Jacquzie we have enjoyed all 3 nights with breakfast in the morning . I thought that I paid such a small amount may be we will get a tiny room but when i saw the room i was surprised its a comfortable room with full size refrigrator and microwave. Staff was really helpfull and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: WhzyG
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOD! First of all, when you drive into this "Inn", it looks like a cheap motel. The parking area is poorly laid out and non-hotel guests are clearly taking up most spots (they don't ask for car info upon check in... we could have parked five cars and no one would have noticed). When you walk to your room, the concrete looks worn and the walls are not clean. When you get in, the room looks nice enough but oh no... the lighting is terrible, the shower is too short (and I am only 5'5"), and the hair dryer was a rusted fire-hazard. On the shower thing again, my head was about two inches taller than the shower (see photos for this). Ah, and there was no shampoo or soap when we came in. We had to go request it. When it came time for the continental breakfast, there were only sweet pastries, waffles, sugary cereals available. There was nothing without sugar (wait, there was plain, cheap looking toast). No bagels, no hard boiled eggs, and no healthy cereal options. The juice was out of a metal machine which gives only watered down orange juice. Next, the milk. The containers to keep the milk cold were uncovered (they were in metal, insulated containers as are seen in coffee shops). Yes, uncovered so not insulated and open to the elements. Their fridge was available for anyone to get into and there were 6 gallons of milk, all expiring tomorrow (Saturday). Hmm... I wonder what milk they will be serving on Monday? The elevators are too small, clunky, loud, and slow. The one cart available for luggage is filthy and falling apart. Oh and the coffee was just awful tasting. Lastly, while my colleagues were out at meetings I decided to at least lounge by the pool to relax (after spending the night stressed about the disgusting hotel and morning unfulfilled by a terrible breakfast) until meeting for lunch. No such luck. They have a worker painting around the edges of the un-drained pool. Oh and if you have an iPad, don't bother trying to connect to their wifi. Their login system will only freeze safari and it never connects. I was able to connect using my MacBook Pro and I am currently on their network, writing this review.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Hilton, but it does it's job!”
Reviews.Author: Morasco84
Reviews.Content: I was petrified of staying here after reading some of these reviews. I had booked way ahead and got a 20% discount but no chance of refund, so I hoped for the best. I am not sure where many of the other people stay usually, but this place was fine. My 19 year-old and I stayed there for 4 nights. Enjoyed having the kitchenette, did not take part in the complimentary breakfast. Pool and hot tub looked clean, there were people in it at all times of the day. Room was clean, nice water pressure. Spent most of our days exploring San Diego which was a straight shot down 8 and every night we came back to a nearly completely full parking lot. Must not be too bad. Not a Hilton, but clean and reasonable, that's all I needed.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvmyboys9802
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 days 3 nights while my son attended a football camp. We thought we would save some money by cooking some meals instead of eating out, well the kitchenette was the only good thing in this hotel. First of all we were on the second floor and the elevator near our room only worked from 7am to 7pm. Also the door to our room looked like it had been broken down. The first night we were there we couldn't sleep we were itching so bad, I had to go buy lysol the next day and sprayed the beds. If you do decide to stay here make sure you bring your own towels, there was 4 of us and they only gave us two very thin and rough towels, and if you use the pool, don't expect pool towels. The sink and shower head were very low and I'm 5'2". As I said the kitchen was the only good thing...I brought my own dishes and was able to cook dinner. The hotel seems like it could be something very nice if the owners took the time to care for it...to sum it up...when we arrived Monday night we threw out a box of leftover chicken in a trash can by the stairs....when we left Thursday it was still there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jandlsmom
Reviews.Content: My mother, my daughter and my son and I are actually finishing our last night in this hotel after a long weekend visit. This place sucks! We have the room right next to the elevator and breakfast room. The door has a lot of play, I had to shove a towel under the door to reduce the hallway light (which I can squeeze my hand under), there's also a lot of freeway noise. The bathtub is dirty, there's mold on ceiling, the bathroom fan isn't working, the beds are hard, the pillows are too big and the carpet is dirty. The front staff was incredibly rude to my mother. The breakfast room is ok, bummed there's no fruit but the staff is in there refilling and eating as well. Neighbors have left out boxes of beer in front of their rooms, and walked by one room and it smelled of marijuana. I will never stay here again. Do not come here with your children!!! We stayed here with hopes it was a decent hotel, close to my brother's house. We have previously stayed at a hotel by the marina and had a pleasant stay. We tried this hotel out because it's closer to my brother's home. Never again. I'll travel the extra miles for a more safer and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would never recommend to anybody”
Reviews.Author: FFSC
Reviews.Content: unfortunately agree with most of the negative reviews before ... booked over hotwire... no possibility for a refund but as a frequent hotwire customer I'll try anyway as this hotel is ZERO QUALITY, just pretense New carpets but the 2 rooms we booked smelled anyway. AC in 1 room was filled up with old breadcrumbs and smelled even worse when turned on, fan in the bathroom started when you switched the light on and sounded like a jet when starting, showerhead at about 5" no possibility to adjust, kitchenette?, a microwave, a fridge and overpainted several yasrs old furniture, breakfast was offered in a "room" that looked more like a hole in the wall, whirlpool was in need of new paint, dirty, way tooo hot and and time switch didn't work either (hottub was only good to clean your feet what -so it appeared - most people did. breakfast - yes they tried - but even the little jelly boxes were probably the cheapest -imported- possible and tasted ..yuck! I could continue but.... just two (three) more things: I'm seriously angry that a)"days inn" let something like this operate under its name even if (what was stated at the front desk) its independently operated by an investor. b)hotwire offers this property to its customers with a 75% customer satisfaction rate (a rate that I really can not believe looking at this motel and remembering what I just saw) How can somebody write about good service at this place ??? if you would like to go there then Pool hours are still terrible, another thing - I got checked in at 9pm by the general manager ...we booked two rooms and not even HE could make sure that our two rooms were adjacent (we ended up on two different floors) unbelievable ... the breakfast lady starts running away with coffee,tea and lemonade at 9:20 even if breakfast is offered until 9:30...one room didn't have an electronic lock and romeservice left it OPEN with all our stuff (incl. a -hidden- laptop computer) inside or location ... .... directly beside the interstate .... but what about the noise ?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horribly Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Jen2468
Reviews.Content: We have been trying to find a great deal on a nice hotel on priceline.com for the past couple of months for our weekend getaway. Just a leisurely trip to have some fun with my kids (girls - ages 9, 13, 21, and 26) so we booked this place for what seemed like a reasonable price($80.00). When we got there, we could already tell from the outside that it was pretty drab from the outside. The outdoor lamps were broken and crooked, the pool was really tiny and shallow (not to mention dirty), the building itself was cracked and dirty, and the inside lobby area looked very dark and drab. We parked in the garage area and grabbed a cart and wheeled our luggage into the room. When we walked into the room, we were already disgusted. The room smelled musty, we were told we had two queen beds but there were two full-sized beds, the microwave and fridge were dirty, there was a large stain in the bathtub, the showerhead was plastic and bulky and not tall enough for any average-sized person. On top of all that, the lighting in the room was terrible and dark. Then when we thought it couldn't get any worse...my oldest daughter had seen the 20/20 TV show about bed bugs in motels so she decided to check the bedding. There was a large crusty stain on the blanket, and numerous other stains on both bed's bedding. Then when she lifted up the matress, we were apalled at what we saw: a dirty pair of women's underwear (a thong) and a visa card. When we called the lobby, we demanded a refund and told them what we had found. They gave us a refund, and we were put through trying to find another hotel(we finally found a great one after looking at 7 hotels in hotel circle - took us 2 1/2 hours!) I would NOT recommend this MOTEL unless you're into nasty, smelly, motels. Do NOT take your kids here!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Momonthego35
Reviews.Content: this place is a dum - rooms have bugs - doors stick - the hotel is just old and dirty - the only nice rooms are the rooms that have interior doors by the pool area - but other than that the staff is rude - the parking is horrible - if you can find parking - just gross - will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: lushvalley
Reviews.Content: During our stay, we had to call 911 and have the paramedics dispatched. Two staff members came by the room to confirm that we called 911 and one member told us that he would wait and direct the ambulance to our room. The front staff had given my husband directions from the hospital back to the hotel and even offered to pick us up using the shuttle service that evening. The next day, I received a call from one staff member asking if our daughter was okay and was willing to refund any unused nights that might have happened as a result to us leaving early. Every staff member that we came across was helpful and courteous. The room was quite spacious and comfy. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre highway motel, front desk exceptionally helpful over several days”
Reviews.Author: stephandsimon
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel, we booked from overseas and I think the travel agent booked us here because we were thinking of going to seaworld. Its a long way from downtown San Diego, in fact it seems a long way to anywhere. If you have a need to be in this area and want somewhere to sleep its fine, the shower was fantastic. If you dont need to be here, go somewhere nice. I have no idea how much it cost us to stay here, hopefully no more than the super 8 next door or the other five or six very similar highway motels lined up along the service road. Dont believe them when they say breakfast is included, its coffee and a muffin, if you want more you pay. I was very pleasantly surprised by the front desk staff (two different middle aged men on different days, sorry I'm terrible with names) who went out of their way to be pleasant and arrange transport, recommend places of interest and who were both genuinely welcoming. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcmurphy_82
Reviews.Content: HMM. Where shall I start? This was an absolute terrible experience. The shower was dirty an you could see hair in the drain. One of the pillows smelled strong of Old Spice, and could not have been changed since the last visitor... The bed was so old i could feel every spring... The carpet was dirty, the sheets old, and the towels smelled funny... I did not shower in the morning, and didn't dare to visit the breakfast room... If you are going to a chargers match, the motel is near Qualcomm, but there has to be a hundred better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment -should not be allowed to operate!”
Reviews.Author: Two4us
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, my husband was greeted by grumpy staff. They placed us NEXT to the elevator, when we had specifically requested to be away from the elevators. We stayed here with my two 2 1/2 year olds, and a 10-year old. The room was rough - carpet was visibly dingy and gross. Granite counter tops had been placed over warped, and visible 2X4's holding them up. The refrigerator in the kitchen area had huge spaces between appliances, and cheap, well-worn linoleum flooring. My husband and I were afraid to let the kids touch anything. The TV was lousy and probably the most blurry I've tried to watch in years. The breakfast room (right next door) was scary - mold showing on the base of two walls - at least 1 foot in diameter. The "Free" breakfast looked like it came out of the vending machine in the parking garage. It was sparse, to say the least. We ended-up eating out on the second day. It was a joke amongst us guests in the breakfast room on the first day. Many who came in to check-out the breakfast were appalled at both the size of the offerings and the huge gobs of mold on the walls. Some were repulsed like me and quickly left. The pool was okay, but had some debris in it. The location was right off the freeway and within 15 minutes of Sea World, our destination. There were plenty of nice restaurants and a lot of shopping within a few miles' drive. My advice - pay the extra $50 and stay closer to the beach or Sea World, if that's your destination, but don't stay in this hotel!!! What a ripoff!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasfemale
Reviews.Content: The property is old style. Doors open to the outside. There is a decent continental breakfast offered in the morning. The pool area was fairly nice. On the downside we did have a ladybug in our bed on both mornings. No idea where it came from.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel with the basics covered”
Reviews.Author: letstalktravel
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay way after midnight (2:30am). The Days Inn had smoking rooms only left but it works for $75 on Saturday night. Our double queen room (119) was very clean with a full kitchen, microwave, dishwasher, electric stove top and full fridge! Don't forget the granite counter tops in the kitchen and bathroom! The beds were a little hard but plenty of nice big pillows(3) each. The decor was minimal and there was a table and chairs for two. I believe the tv was a 27 inch but we never turned it on. This place was great for the price and took care of us for the night. No funny smell, no strange findings and the A/C worked very well! The location was quiet and our room faced the freeway. Only downfall was the lighting was inadequate for the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Long Days Inn Night”
Reviews.Author: SeattleReviewer123
Reviews.Content: I have driven across the United States and have stayed in some pretty humble accommodations along the way. I can honestly say that I've slept in $29/night truck stop motels that were more pleasant than this one. When I arrived I was given a "non-smoking" room that smelled of smoke (or maybe it was mold). When I complained, I was given another room that smelled exactly the same. The building and elevator were decrepit. In my shower stall was a half melted bar of soap to which some unknown person's body hair was attached. I could feel every single spring in the worn out mattress. And a guest in the next room seemed engaged continuously, and for hours on end, in a very loud and confrontational telephone conversation about either a domestic situation, or perhaps it was a drug deal. The noisy air conditioner in my room helped to drown out this unwanted sound. But I still had a poor night's sleep and was only too happy to leave in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “1 time only”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixMomx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to the rate and ratings that we found online. I thought it can't be that bad. My family and I were vacationing and taking the kids to Sea World. It is rather close but I would not stay here again. The front desk was not helpful and it takes forever to get hot water. The carpets were not clean and I would not allow the kids to walk around without socks.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: l3abs89
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a nice location, near condos and apartments rather than a bunch of other local motels/hotels. Easy access to the freeway was really nice and there is an Albertsons and a Von's close by. The San Diego Zoo and Sea World are a short distance from the hotel and the Wild Animal Park isn't a bad drive either. There are plenty of local restaurants/fast food restaurants in the area as well as two malls within 5-10 minutes of the hotel. The service is average. The man who was always at the counter (probably the manager) wasn't rude but didn't go out of his way to put any happiness in the tone of his voice. Basically he was there doing his job. If I do go back sometime I would just like to see a little more upbeat attitude. Other than that the room was awesome. My boyfriend and I stayed in a non-smoking king suite. The full size fridge/freezer was the best! Other places I have been to only have little dinky mini fridges that you can't fit anything into so it was great to actually be able to get food from the grocery store since we had a fridge to store it in! So if you are looking to get away for awhile I would say go here...great prices for great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: The_Original_Bobo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mission Valley for 3 nights, due to our previous hotel being cancelled (long story). This place was booked by our travel agent at the very last minute, wish it wasn't!! Firstly it's miles from the centre of San Diego and so you need a car to go anywhere, wouldn't rely on buses or taxis as we also tried these out. The (unhelpful) lady on reception didn't have a clue about the bus times or whether they where actually running, she didn't seem to care either. We wanted to go out for a drink and so required a taxi, again we had to ask the the same person on reception, who rang us a taxi. We actually think the taxi was possibly a relative of hers, as the car turned out to have no taxi plates and cost an absolute fortune. It cost us half as much to get back in an orange cab. The hotel room was dirty and smelt unclean. The basin in the bathroom was cracked and the towels had holes in them. Generally it just wasn't nice. When we visit San Diego again we will stay either in the centre around the Gas Lamp district or in Coronado as these places are great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, do not stay more than one night!!”
Reviews.Author: usmcdevildog0300
Reviews.Content: **** DO NOT USE FOR EXTENDED STAY **** Stayed in a King Bedroom My Fiance and I stayed for four nights and got sick. She left with a pretty bad headache and really congested. Negatives: The Air conditioner had mold or something inside of it because it blew dust and gave a musty smell. 2 out of the 3 lamps didn't work. Bathroom was unfinished. Water taste's like chlorine or bleach..take your pick. Non of the kitchen cabinets shut completly. Bathroom shower curtain rod was falling off the wall. Shower head was way too low, built for a smaller person..had to duck to get hair wet. I'm 5' 11" Pool was discusting, was cleaned on the last day we stayed here. Hot tub was the same, and it was also right next to the parking garage, not very much privacy at all. No pool light for at night. Non of the hotel staff spoke fluent english. Location was terrible for this hotel..I.E. Scenery.. Positives: Bed was comfortable Internet was releltivly fast..on the last day we were here. Fridge was okay

Reviews.Title: “low budget”
Reviews.Author: wappr
Reviews.Content: if you're looking for a modest hotel this is not it! This is an extremely low budget hotel way off the beaten track of the local beaches. it is actually closer to El Cajon and SDSU off of 8 East. The rooms are musty and the furshings are outdated. We had 2 rooms, a double and a king. The double had a sink in the kitchenette and the king did not. The bathrooms in the king room had tile missing under the sink where there used to be a vanity...this is in all the king rooms becuase we wanted to switch rooms. You could feel the springs in the bed. The other overall use of the rooms were functional. For breakfast they have corn flakes and coca puffs and some muffins. They also have a waffle machine which the kids loved. The lobby serves as the breakfast area and they pull out two small tables and some chairs...plan to go back to your room. We drove to Mission Beach about 15 min West off the 8. This hotel needs major renovations and deep deep cleaning. There is absolutely no pride of ownership here!!! DO NOT expect anything beyond a low budget stay. The pool and jaquzzi are ok ..no night light for the pool. If you can pick a room with a pool view..DO. The good....the free WiFi works great and there is a 7-11 and Albertson's market right up the road...rooms are cheap and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: seattlefamily1155
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel and chose it just because we needed an inexpensive place to sleep before continuing our trip. We arrived at 11pm and had a little trouble finding a parking space in the full lot, but eventually found a space. Our room was nice- very clean, spacious and updated. There was tons of storage space and a full size kitchen in the room. The continental breakfast was nothing special- an assortment of pastries, toast and cereal. The hotel is not really near anything, its in a very quiet area, just off of the freeways. If we are ever in need of a hotel in San Diego we'll probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unfit for most”
Reviews.Author: twintoja
Reviews.Content: I found this one in a travel coupon book. It was miles out of our way to begin with, and there are no restaurants, other services close by. We walked in to the dingy lobby to behold the breakfast area-basically a counter with some saggy leather couches for seating. We got the keys to the room and went up the elevator. When I opened the door to the room, I was completely confused. Dirty old carpet, pretty new comforters, granite counter tops, unfinished dirty tile in the bathrooms, nice armoire, creepy, broken-down-70's kitchen cabinets, smoky smell in a non-smoking room. I called the front desk and asked for a more "finished" room. We tried two others to find much the same- a half-done remodel with no plans to really finish it. The worst, however, was the pool. It looked like the bath water after my kids have come home from playing at the park all day. Dirty, cloudy and disgusting. We checked out and were quickly refunded our money (the best thing I can say about this place).

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Raud
Reviews.Content: I read the review from golfgirl and echo her sentiments exactly. The room I walked into smelled like animals had been living in it for an extended stay. I immediately changed rooms to a slightly less noxious but still very smelly room. Everything about this place was bad. I also stayed there only for its nexus to the U.S. Open shuttle. I don't know why I didn't check this site before I signed up for that place but I won't make that type of mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Dive”
Reviews.Author: Golfergirl2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely disgusting. First, the sidewalks and hallways were gross and dirty, looked like they had never been cleaned. This hotel boasted "suites" and every room had a kitchen. Too bad the cleaning staff didn't do a very good job. There was rotting food in the disposals, it smelled so bad we ended up putting a wet washcloth in the drain to block the smell. We would have changed rooms but this was already the 3rd room we tried. The first room had maintanence going on and rubble everywhere. The second room was not the bed preference we reserved and there was leftover food bags all over the kitchen and dirty dishes on the counter. The staff were not very friendly and would rather talk on the cell phone then to help a customer. The attempt to spuce up the room with new paint looked like it was done by a 5 year old. The pool and spa closed at 8pm, way too early. Why did we stay? With the US Open in the area, there wasn't much else to choose from under $250. The price we paid was also out the window at $125 a night. A $60 Motel 6 would have been leaps ahead. I wish I had taken pictures for all to see just how bad it was.

Reviews.Title: “A few redeeming features”
Reviews.Author: BrentwoodBear
Reviews.Content: Externally very unattractive, with poor room access due to few stairs and elevator being poorly located. Clientele had a bit of a shady look, with a lot of open doors and partying going on. The room itself was better than the exterior, as a full kitchenette was provided in my 2 Queen suite. However, maintenance was not up to par as two different lights didn't function. Access to Qualcomm stadium was good, also there is a trolley stop a short distance away which provided good access to downtown SD and the gaslamp district. Free high speed internet was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Should have listened to bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: dgosse
Reviews.Content: When I read some of the bad reviews on this hotel, I thought that people were being too picky. They were right. I would recommend that you stay away from this hotel. It is in a poor location right on the freeway and away from everything. The first room we were in smelled horrible. We moved to another room the next day that still smelled, but not as bad. I don't mind if a room is outdated given the cheap price that we paid, but these rooms smell and are not clean. The counter in the kitchenette was not even cleaned off. One night the toilet clogged and when I called down to front desk for assistance they told me that they were the only one on so I would have to go to the lobby to pick up a plunger. Then they checked us out one day early, so that when we came back to our room one evening they had changed our locks so we could not get back in our room. Then I had waste another 1/2 hour at the front desk so that I could get our key. The front desk staff just do not care about anything. With all the complaints we had they did not even say they were sorry and they really should have given us a free room the last night for all of our troubles, but did nothing. Oh, and another morning they called us at 4:30 for a wake up call that was certainly for someone else. Last note - there were bees outside our room everyone morning. Do yourself a favour and spend a bit more money on a better hotel closer to the Mission Bay area. It took some of the pleasure out of our trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Receptionist!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler31082
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few Days Inn hotels and I am not a very picky person. Some of them were worse than the others. But this time I just had to write a review because I want to let others know about our experience. The receptionist at this hotel seemed to have mood swings so one moment she was very nice and helpful and the next she was rude and unfriendly. She was probably acting nice when the managers were around. We stayed at this hotel for one night. We made a reservation over the phone and when we arrived we asked the receptionist if we can see the room before we take it and she rudely replied: "We don't do that." I wanted to see the room to make sure that the streets and the highway surrounding it were not too loud for me to sleep. But now we had to stay there or else we would be charged a cancellation fee. And if she nicely explained this to us, we would understand. Two other women waited to talk to her and she was also kind of rude to them. The room turned out to be nice and the cars were suprisingly not too loud. The room was clean and everything seemed fine, but it was not as nice as the rooms on the photographs. In the morning, at like 9:02 AM we called to see until what time breakfast was served, and the same girl answered and said: "Until now." So we searched for their hotel directory and found out that it was served until 10 AM. We went downstairs and she seemed like she didn't want to deal with us, but she was being friendly to some other customers. So I complained that she told us that the breakfast was over, but it was still being served, and she just said something like: "Well ... go eat it, you can eat it now." I would completely understand if she nicely said: "I am sorry, but the breakfast is over at 9." And even if she made a mistake, she could have at least apologised. So I wrote a letter describing what happened with the receptionist and sent it to the manager of the hotel. I hope that he received it. As I said, hotel receptionists should make guests feel welcome. Their job is to handle guests' requests during their stay. What I felt at this hotel was that the receptionist just did not care and was unwilling to do anything to help us or to make us feel welcome. I would not stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: chapsCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights, I did not look up reviews on this hotel before I left which I will never do again. This hotel is old and run down. Same as the other reviews the rooms smell bad, My toilet seat was even cracked. No security. I could go on for a while. I wanted to turn around and leave but it was midknight when i got there. I also asked for a non-smoking room and when I got there thats all they had left. I highly reccomend to go else where if your looking to go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “just barely ok”
Reviews.Author: johnnyyuma
Reviews.Content: Old and pretty much wore out. The room had a musty,dusty feel and smell. Check in time was later than advertised.The noise level from the nearby freeway was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: NathanW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over labor day weekend. It was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in! The front desk staff overcharged us for one night, despite the fact that I had my confirmation print out indicating the rate I was supposed to pay. They did correct this eventually but I had to go back a couple of times in order for them to fix it. The room smelled like cigarettes and rotten food despite being "nonsmoking". The first room smelled so bad that we had to request a different room. Overall the hotel was very run down with terrible service from the front desk staff. I would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & safe, but worn”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAirstreamer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, in a safe area and conveniently located; however, the room fixtures were very worn. Most of the other reviews were pretty accurate, and we got what we paid for. Parking was good (and free), and the pool and spa were surprisingly well-maintained. If you are just looking for an inexpensive, clean, safe room, this property is a good value. If you expect more, you need to look a little further down the road. We paid $89 a night and stayed three nights. There's a nice, mom and pop family restaurant just over the hill on Waring Road, in the strip mall (on the west side of the road) -- "The Brothers Restaurant". We had lunch there one day and breakfast the following morning. It's not fancy, but the food is great, and the prices were very reasonable. With four people for breakfast, we had to pull two tables together when the food came, because we all got two platters each! Make sure at least one person in your party orders "Grandma Jenny's Fabulous Pancakes". They're great; but the order is huge, and the rest of you can share the unfinished portion for dessert!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: keepthempolar
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at the hotel, I was completely worried about the cleanliness and overall atmosphere of the hotel. I read that the hotel was smelly and dirty. However, the rooms that I stayed in were beyond my expectations. The front desk didn't give me my rooms until around 2 pm when in actuality I got there at 1pm at the supposed check-in time, but my friends and I didn't mind the wait. The rooms were clean and very nicely assembled. The only thing that I would complain about is the location of the hotel. It is in the middle of nowhere. There was construction right next to the hotel and no stores or anything around the area. It was completely deserted, but if you plan to drive around San Diego, it should be fine. It's about 20 minutes from La Jolla Beach and 10 minutes from the Gaslamp district. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anybody looking for a cheap but yet comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even try to use GIFT CERIFICATES here”
Reviews.Author: DaysInnStinks
Reviews.Content: I won some gift certificates to Days Inn and Sea World back in February. I booked a room at this hotel for two nights at $150 a night. Upon arrival at the hotel just after 1pm, I was told that check in was not until 3pm. The desk clerk said they would try to get us in early and when I presented the $250 in gift certificates with my credit card I was told that the hotel does not accept gift certificates issued by Days Inn even though the certificates say they are good at ANY Days Inn in the U.S. and Puerto Rico for one year from the date (February 2007) of issue. After contacting Days Inn customer service I was told that the certificates have been phased out. We wasted an hour at the front desk as well as cell phone minutes trying to get the situation rectified and was eventually offered the room at the walk in rate of $79 a night. After putting the room on my credit card and being stuck with $250 worth of bogus gift certificates I will probably never stay at another Days Inn anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jtbillman
Reviews.Content: We absolutely enjoyed our stay here. The room was spacious and very clean! The kitchen was pretty much useless though but you can check out pots and pans from the front desk. The pool was clean the jacuzzi was warm! It felt great after a day of swimming in the ocean! The hotel is about 10 minutes from Sea World, Ocean Beach, and Mission Beach. About 5 minutes from Old Town and 15 minutes from Torrey Pines Beach! IF you are looking for a great family beach, go to torrey pines! We had a great stay at this hotel and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spare yourself!”
Reviews.Author: my2ragdolls
Reviews.Content: It was our first family vacation with our 2 year old daughter, and we were immediately deflated when we opened the door to what was to be our room for the next week. The carpeting and flooring were filthy, the bathroom and kitchet cabinets were gaping (making me feel that anything could be lurking), and I couldn't imagine showering or bathing our daughter there. We got into the Motel 6 in Hotel Circle the next day and thoroughly enjoyed the rest of our vacation. No frills ( had pool & coffee in office) just CLEAN! The owner of Days Inn didn't ask why we checked out early...I had the feeling it wasn't uncommon, so SPARE YOURSELF!

Reviews.Title: “Won't Let Husband Book Hotel Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took 6 young kids to San Diego, 3 boys and 3 girls and wanted adjoining rooms and something reasonably priced, we were there for 4 nights. We got the reasonably priced but that was it! They knew how many people were in each room and each day we had to ask for more towels and wash cloths. Roaches ran us over to the point the luggage stayed in the yard when we got home until all clothes were washed and put away to make sure we did not bring any of them in the house with us. The coffee pot was there in one room, not the other but you never knew if you were going to have coffee or sweetner and something to stir, kind of useless. The furnishings were old and painted over several times trying to make them look better but cig burn marks were everywhere. People had scratch graffeti in the photo frames, tacky! The toilet leaked all of the time, the AC would not cool the small room. I will not go back. If you are looking for cheap this is it, but don't expect anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean clean, not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: SDVacation2006
Reviews.Content: My boys and I took a long-awaited trip to San Diego. I booked this hotel six months in advance, and crossed my fingers that all would be well when we got there. We stayed in Room 225, a non-smoking room with two queen size beds and a full kitchen. The hotel is very nicely kept up, freshly painted on the outside. The lobby is very clean. In fact, in my experience, the entire hotel was CLEAN, CLEAN CLEAN. The room was a little shabby, but as I said, very clean. My requirements for the hotel that we chose were: 1. Had to be CLEAN. 2. No mold. 3. No funny smells. And I was not disappointed in my requirements, although there were some funny smells when you ran the bathroom fan. If you ran it for any length of time, the bathroom smelled like smoke because we were on the corner and there were two smoking rooms on either side of us. Sort of a weird way to do non-smoking rooms, but whatever. The microwave did not work well. There was no rotating plate and I was afraid to use it. The sheets were clean, the blanket was pilled, and the bedspread had cigarrette holes in it, but they were very clean. The carpet was a little . . .odd . . . it felt funny under my feet, but it could be because it was old and the carpet pad had flattened out a lot. The air conditioner was very effective and very quiet. Didn't see any sign of mold, cockroaches or other vermin. In fact . . I know I keep saying this . .but everything was very very clean. The only glitch we encountered was that one day our room was not cleaned. When I called about this, I was informed that because we were staying for an entire week, they only cleaned your hotel room once. When I said, "But they've cleaned it the last four days in a row," basically that was a bonus. If this policy is true, then I definitely would not stay in a place where they won't make your bed and keep it CLEAN no matter how long you stay there. But I asked them nicely to clean it the next day, and they did, and that was the last day we stayed there so it worked out. Everyone was very nice and accommodating, the staff is excellent. Because we booked early and were AAA members we got an excellent price: $593 for a seven-night stay. And yes that included taxes. We felt very safe in the room and the area. The room did start to get a little oppressive towards the end of our stay, because it was shabby, but the kids really enjoyed the cable TV during the evenings. We'd run around and wear ourselves out during the day, then come home and sleep, get up and fix breakfast and run out the door in the morning for a day of fun. The next time I go to San Diego I think I will stay at a hotel by the beach. This hotel was a good economy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boohead
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that my family and I are not used to staying in upscale hotels by any means. We stay at Days Inn or Travelodge quite often. Having read the other reviews on this site I was weary of staying here but still I thought maybe the other reviewers were just picky. From the outside the place looked decent enough, with a smallish pool that seemed clean and pleasant. The lobby was nothing great but still decent. Then I asked where the restroom was and was given a key and told it was up two floors on the elevator. My daughter and I took the ride while my husband checked in. As soon as I stepped into the elevator I noticed the horrible smell. It reminded me of old musty apartments where people had a bunch of animals or something....not good. Then we get to the bathroom and unlock it only to find more nasty smell. Like I said it was a mixture of old yuck and animals and smoke. I hoped that this wasn't going to be the case with our room but boy was I wrong. On our walk to the room you couldn't escape the horrible smell, it was truly overwhelming. Sure enough once we walked into our room it got worse. It was the same smell with a TON of some sort of citrus cleaner over it. It actually burned our eyes and throat. At first glance the room looked okay but as I turned on more lights I wasn't impressed. The nightstands were literally covered in cigerette burns. All the furniture was marked up with black marks and dents and burns. Then I pulled back the bedspread and the sheets looked dirty and the bedspread and sheets both had a bunch of cigarette burns. Now the sheets weren't wrinkly or anything so they probably were clean but boy were they nasty looking. Onto the kitchen area I went. The microwave and stove and fridge were all okay and seemed fairly clean. The cabinets and counters were just old and icky looking. Like I said I am used to staying in places like days inn but this was just not what one would expect. It reminded me so much of really nasty apartments I looked at when I was younger! The bathroom wasn't nice by any means either, it wasn't the worst I've seen though. I guess I'd give it about a four out of ten. Maybe I could've handled this place if I were only staying for one night, but then I wouldn't need a place with a kitchen if I were only staying one night. We were to be there six nights but I knew right away that there was absolutely no way I was staying there that long. For one thing I didn't want to bring my clothes in and end up having all of our stuff stink. So for the first time in all my life we left in search of other lodging. We wanted to check out right then but it was the friday of memorial weekend and we were afraid we wouldn't find anything else. Luckily we did about 2 hours later. When we checked out the clerk didn't act suprised at all that we were leaving all ready (I'm assuming this sort of thing might happen a lot here). Then she told my husband she'd only charge him sixteen something dollars which was great. So overall I would definately say DO NOT stay at this place. I did notice however that as we were leaving the place was literally filling up with people. I just wanted to warn them all not to do it!!!! I guess to sum it up all I can say is that the place smelled like an old stinky bar with lots of dogs and it looked just as bad. All in all if it wasn't for the horrid smell I might've tried to stick it out but all together it was just not worth spending our vacation being grossed out by our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn MV is in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: lydiafoster
Reviews.Content: After reading about roaches and mold, I was a bit afraid, but found myself pleasantly surprised. All of the rooms have full kitchens, so if you want to save money in SD, this would be a great hotel for you! The appliances were all very clean and in working condition. Also, the location was great--right off the 8, close to the 805 and 15, and the 169 was only a few miles away. The location made SD easy to access, but allowed us to stay in a quiet location with *free parking*. The room did have an odor of stale cigarettes--it didn't help that the room next door was a smoking room. At times you could also catch whiffs of cooking. I think bringing an air freshner is a great idea. However, for $80 on Labor Day weekend (we booked in early Aug.), this was an amazing find, and I'd certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Mission Valley clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn from August 2 thru August 11. When we checked in Fia was most helpful. We had 5 room reserved but ended up with three room on one side and the other two on the opposite side of the building. Rooms were clean, Moses 9THE gENERAL MANAGER) and his employees were very helpful. One room did have an odd odor (COOKING) so we put air fresher throught the room the odor when away. This hotel might not have been a five star hotel be the 19 people who were in the group were happly with the room and service. If the hotel owner put some money into the corporation Days Inn would be a diamond in the rough. Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “the bad reviews are lies, this hotel rocks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel is awesome! it has everything you need there! it has a clean bathroom, a big refrigirator, a microwave, and a large room. I would recommand anyone to stay at this hotel. At first when I read the reviews, I was scared out of my pants to even reserve the hotel, but now I am really glad I did, cause I had the time of my life. I enjoyed my stay there with my family very much. The service was excellent. The manager and people that work there are so friendly, u wouldn't even believe it. There was no cockroaches there at all, you wouldn't even find a baby ant on the floor if you tried. There was no mold in the bathroom or anywhere else and the cleanliness of the room was amazing! San diego zoo and sea world and the other attractions are very nearby this hotel, so that was pretty satisfying! I luved this hotel and I know you would to if u stayed there 4 a few days!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed for 6 days good clean rooms large,friendly people ,enjoyed the pool and hot tub. would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Average, but clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here, figuring we'd spend a lot of time out vacationing, and little time actually at our hotel. We feel that we got what we expected, and what we paid for. The room was clean enough, though very warn. Water stains on the ceiling, mold around the cracks in the bathroom. Clean sheets, hard bed. The bathroom was definitely aged, and featured a shower head so low that we had to duck to get under the flow. No bug problems. On the plus side, the kitchen (microwave, oven, fridge, sink) added a lot of convenience to our trip. The hotel grounds are quite beautiful, and very well kept, and the service was excellent. The front desk is manned almost entirely by one person, Moses, the manager. We could tell that he tries very hard to run a clean operation and to keep both his staff and guests happy. Underground parking, monitored by video. Everything you could expect in a complimentary continental breakfast: donuts, fresh fruit, juices, cereal, milk, and toast.

Reviews.Title: “They don't come any worse than this”
Reviews.Author: pchas
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. My room was infested with cockroaches. My business colleague's bed sheet was stained. The rooms had a nauseous smell of bug spray and air freshener. I had reserved rooms for myself and 5 colleagues for a business trip, but we could not stand it, so we checked out the next morning it was so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, I was double charged for the room, over $250 extra was charged on my card. The front desk worker was rude when I went in to correct the issue. It took 4-5 days for the money issue to be corrected, which affected my vacation spending. The bathroom ceiling above the toilet was leaking in our room, as well (room # 128). They stated that coffee makers would be available upon request, when one was requested, they said they had none available, but would send one up eventually. They never did. They also never informed us that there was a coffee maker available in the front lobby if we wanted to use that one. We opened our door to accept a delivery, to find police officers a few doors down, dealing with someone, and they began to look us over for no reason. That same room was also getting loud visitors whom repeatedly came around banging on the persons door and causing a scene, yelling about calling the cops. We asked the front desk worker about getting a taxi to the nearest Denny's, and were sent 4-5 miles out of our way, to find that there was another establishment much closer than that one had been. Maid service was very inconsiderate and ill-timed. We decided to extend our stay at the last minute, the front desk worker tried to charge $10 extra from the originally quoted rate. On the last night we paid for, he told us in a very rude tone that there were no more nights available after that night, and that the rates would change anyway. He also would not agree to give us the reciept we had requested, after we asked him numerous times for one. He said it would be 2 pages, and when we said that was fine, we wanted it anyway, he said that it "wasn't necessary" and refused it flat out. On one of the nights we attempted to pay for an additional nights stay there, the front desk worker refused to make change, therefore sending us to walk roughly 2 miles up the road after midnight, to the nearest gas station, only to find it closed, as well as every other store in the area. After the first night of our stay, HBO was scrambled on the TV and did not come back for the entire time we stayed there. The continental breakfast was not what we expected, the coffee was cheap, the pastries tasted days old. The whole experience ruined our vacation, the front desk workers were unfriendly and inconsiderate. We were very, very unhappy with our experience with the hotel. Got a smoking room with two beds when requested a non-smoking room with one king sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “$41 Well Spent!”
Reviews.Author: ChileChef
Reviews.Content: We were really hesitant to even pull in the parking lot after reading the reviews on this hotel. The imminent threat of cockroach parties in the rooms and quicksand like sticky carpets that rob you of your socks had us ready to bail on our reservation. So like the sane reasonable people we try to be, we set up a contingency plan and proceeded forth to meet our doom. We arrived late, about 12:30 am. The doors to the lobby were locked and the person behind the glass doors instructed us to make our way around the night registration window in the underground parking lot. The service at the window was prompt, friendly and filled with the information we needed to find parking and our room quite easily. The facility itself was clean and seemed to be in good condition. As we walked to our second floor room we passed the well manicured pool area. While it was too chilly to consider swimming the pool was in good condition and the hot tub was steaming away ready for any who dare to dip. So now, the moment of truth. I slide the card key into its designated door slot and when the green light tells me itâ€™s time we slowly slide the door open to seeâ€¦â€¦â€¦. A GREAT ROOM! While the renovation is a little cheesy, the Formica counters had been painted over, the room was very acceptable. It was a clean large room with a king sized bed, a full kitchen, large bathroom, sleeper sofa, 27â€� TV, free HBO and a remote that was not nailed to the night stand. The carpets were clean, the room did not smell bad, and there were no roaches. It was a nice room. While I would not bring my Girlfriend there to propose or anything it is certainly a place I would stay again. We paid $41 a day and every penny of it was well spent. It was a good room, close to everything if you know your way around or have a map. The only thing I though was seriously deficient was the so called continental breakfast. Donâ€™t waste your time. If your gonna offer a free continental breakfast at least spring for fresh donuts and take the twist tie off the bag of generic bread, butter might be nice too?

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: inastance
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I was very concerned about staying at this property this past weekend. I had prepaid months ago before I found these reviews. This is not a five-star hotel, but it was clean, the rooms were large, and not only wasn't my carpet sticky, but I didn't see one cockroach. I was certainly not unhappy with my stay, particularly since my group stayed at the Good Nite Inn - Sea World Area a few weeks ago. I expected that Days Inn would be as bad, if not worse (which is saying something), but the opposite proved to be true. For the money, no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “So-so, at best”
Reviews.Author: realkyhick
Reviews.Content: Days Inn and Suites/Mission Valley is another budget-priced hotel that tends to turn me off because of the general upkeep of the property. It's apparently been "re-flagged" (industry-speak for a change of chain, or lack of chain/independent) from another brand, and the makeover attempts were less than successful. A number of rooms are suites of the extended-stay variety, and the property seems to atttract a number of work crews on jobs in the area. The pool areas are pretty decent. Access to rooms is awkward, unless you're fortunate enough to snatch one of the handful of parking spaces under the motel's first floor, which has direct access to an elevator. Otherwise, you must climb stairs, or else traipse around to the ground-level parking entrance to get to the elevator. Rooms were clean, fairly roomy and generally in good repair, but still had that cheap look about them. Local phone calls cost 40 cents, plus a nickel for every minute over 15, so Internet access can cost; high speed Internet access is only in the lobby through a kiosk. The weeknight price is good, with welcome-center coupon books offering a $49 rate for one bed; two beds was ten bucks more. Desk staff was friendly. Location is pretty good, with major attractions about 10 minutes away; new San Diego Trolley extension, open in early 2005, is just across I-8. One Italian restaurant next door, but that's it for the area. It's an OK place if money is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at Days Inn in Mission Valley, unless you like cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all the service was not very nice, the lady was almost rude at the time of the check-in and acted as she was very tired. The room was fine, but when we decided to take a nap, an while in the bed, we saw a huge black cockroach on the pillow. It felt terrible, I went up to the front desk and told the lady what had just happened. She did not even appologize, and only said that they could offer us another room and anyway we would not be able to find another motel because it was a long weekend. It was disgusting and left right away. No one ever apologized to us. So if you like bad service and cockroaches, you'll love that place.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, the location was okay for getting to Sea World, Zoo etc. It was only about a 10 min drive to each. We had a great room rate of $55.oo per night, however we had reserved that rate for a 2 queen bed suite and what we got was a king suite with a sofa bed.(which should have been cheaper). Kind of a pain to pull the sofa bed out every night for our kid to sleep in, not to mention it blocked off the path to the bathroom. I was extremely disappointed to find that there was not a coffemaker in the room, nor did they have one available. It did have a full kitchen which was great for TV dinners, although we had to go buy paper plates, etc. The room itself was dirty. The maid had vacumned near the entrance but not rest of the room, so you could see white papers on the dark carpet. Which brings me to the worst part, the carpet and tile floors in the kitchen and bathroom. Talk about filthy. The carpet is a dark color so you couldn't see the dirt but you could feel the stickiness if you were barefoot. It was so gross! The tile flooring was also sick and I ended up getting extra towels so I could use them as rugs on the floors so my shoes would quit sticking. On day 2, the maid again did not vacumn the entire room, only near the entrance. Also on day 2, The toliet began having problems flushing and by day 3 you could not flush it at all. The maid did not speak english so no luck getting a plunger. The Jacuzzi was cold, only about 85 degrees. When we checked out we were charged 40 cents for a local call, which we did not make. At the time the call was placed, we were at Sea World, so apparently the maid made the call while she should have been vacumning. Also, no fan in the bathroom, so when you took a shower, the steam buildup was awful, leaving everyting wet in the whole place, which only made the floor stickiness worse. The room was cheap, however, next time I'll pay $80.00 to stay at Travelodge or similar, I'll have a clean room, with good service and I will have a coffemaker in my roofridge anyway. It was really a dump, but it was cheap. I really think it was overpriced for how dirty it was...my feet turned black after one walk across the carpet. That was just the worst. Oh, I forgot to mention the smell. It smelled dirty, probably from the carpet.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Mission Valley
